p.s: Last week I read an article at a norwayNorwegian newspaper.
Three young people, who are interested in fashion, visited a textile industrieindustry in Cambodia.
They wanted to see, how life of a seamstress in Cambodia is.
I know, that you always praispraise the effects of globalisation, but you easily forget about the poor people in these countries.
So I decided to write a few things about this article.
Maybe it is something for you.
When Anniken, Frida and Ludvig arrived at the textile industrieindustry, their life completlycompletely changed for these days.
They talked to the people who worked there, they visited supermarkets and shops for clothes, they slept in a little house of a seamstress and they also shared a mattress for the night.
In addition the three people, ate a lot of rice and had to look after themselves.
At the end, Anniken, Frida and Ludvig were shocked.
They also said, that they had to do the same work every single day and every time.
So they decided to stand up and to do something against the workers at the textile industrieindustry.
Of course, you can read a lot more of this article, but I decided to tell you the important information.
If you want to read more of the article, I can send you the link too.
I hope, you change your opinion and I also hope that you don't forget these people in the future.
